metadata.title: CVE-2017-5367 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple reflected XSS vulnerabilities exist within form and link inputparameters of ZoneMinder v1.30 and v1.29, an open-source CCTV server webapplication, which allows a remote attacker to execute malicious scriptswithin an authenticated client's browser. The URL is /zm/index.php andsample parameters could include action=login&view=postlogin[XSS]view=console[XSS] view=groups[XSS]view=events&filter[terms][1][cnj]=and[XSS]view=events&filter%5Bterms%5D%5B1%5D%5Bcnj%5D=and[XSS]view=events&filter%5Bterms%5D%5B1%5D%5Bcnj%5D=[XSS]andview=events&limit=1%22%3E%3C/a%3E[XSS] (among others).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5367` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zoneminder - 1.30.4+dfsg1-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zoneminder package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.30.4+dfsg1-5').
